Keywords: Brotherhood of Mutants , Defenders , Exiles , X-Men
Real Name: Calvin Rankin
Special Powers
RALLY (5): Opposing Attack Rolls. FREE: Remove Mimic's RALLY die to choose a displayed standard power a character within range and line of fire can use. Mimic can use the chosen power until your next turn. (RALLY: Once per roll for each die in a finalized attack roll and for all characters with a matching RALLY die and trait color printed under their trait star, after resolutions you may choose a friendly character to gain a matching RALLY die. RALLY trait colors specify which attack type they can gain RALLY dies from. BLUE = Friendly Attack Rolls. RED = Opposing Attack Rolls. GREEN = All Attack Rolls. When a character gains a RALLY die, place a die with the matching result on their card.)
POWER MIMICRY: At the beginning of the game, give a Mimicry token to a character on your Sideline with a point cost less than or equal to Mimic and with the X-Men or Brotherhood of Mutants keyword. // Mimic can use the displayed standard powers on the starting click of the character with his Mimicry token.
DESPERATELY PICKING UP POWERS: STOP. Toughness. // When this click is first revealed, you may move the Mimicry token to another character with the X-Men or Brotherhood of Mutants keyword on your Sideline if able.

June 19, 2021
Redrover454
XDPS 011b Magneto will be my go-to. Turns him into a 12/5 RS/PB. A lite version of CAAV Chase Thor for your X-Men. HX 100 Rogue is another excellent option that I haven't seen mentioned. With RS/PB and Invincible, Mimic gets a full dial of Invincible in a set where virtually no one else can reduce Pen dmg while he's dishing it out.
June 13, 2021
Organous
I'm guessing this does not include standard powers that are included within special powers displayed. Also unsure whether traits or Hypersonic Speed via Transporter would be granted, but probably not. Still, this does bring a *lot* of potential. Just offhand, my thoughts went to colossal Iceman, though that technically wouldn't work as you need sideline elements to be at their maximum point value. A casual look through just pieces I own shows: Doop: Sidestep, Invincible, CCE. We got ourselves a solid beater there. Mercury: Plasticity, Precision Strike, Super Senses, Shape Change. He's a bit heavy to be a tie-up piece, but this would make him difficult to address. Give him a little equipment and I'd say he will easily earn his points. HX022 Wolverine: Charge, PS, CR, EW. I'd rather not make him a close piece if I can help it, but this *would* make him a good one. HX 003a Bishop: Standard RS + P/PB and Outwit. Simple, but effective. WCR007 Gambit: RS, ES/D, Perplex. A quick look at Transporter characters, just in case that would apply, shows DoFP Storm. If somehow it goes beyond just colored boxes and gives [b]everything[/b] the character would have, you get HSS, RS, EE, Perplex, Leadership (when he loses it), and ES/D. Geez, even without Transporter mattering, GX049 Archangel gives a sickening RS, P/PB, ES/D, and Shape Change! If I get this Mimic, I just might have to grab Archangel specifically for him. I also feel a little sketchy on this, but wouldn't you be able to just fill up your sideline with options so that you can pick the one you want? At the very least it seems you could plausibly have 2. So, I could have someone that focuses on range with a backup for a melee-themed piece if Stealth is a problem.
June 13, 2021
Emtemss
I see a lot of potential here. But honestly at the end of the day what I see the most is a potentially super fun piece, that looks to have ag reat sculpt. Not bad.
